snippet: The continuing wait for faster growth has reinforced the concern of some critics that the Fed is retreating too quickly from its bond-buying campaign.
abstract: Federal Reserve will publish updated forecasts that are likely to reflect more modest expectations than 3-percent growth predicted in June 2013; policy-making committee is still expected to announce another $10 billion cut in its monthly bond purchase, to $35 billion a month, in keeping with its plan to end purchases; continuing wait for faster growth reinforces concerns that Fed is retreating too quickly from its stimulus campaign.
lead_paragraph: The continuing wait for faster growth has reinforced the concern of some critics that the Fed is retreating too quickly from its bond-buying campaign.

headline.main: The Fed Appears to Have Been Wrong About Growth. Again.
headline.print_headline: Fed Expected to Reduce Growth Forecast Again but Still Cut Stimulus
headline.content_kicker: A Recovery in Need of a Recovery
